name: Joyce Gorski
text: You can build your own pizza similar Subway. The pizza taste delicious price  for Lunch special $6.99 with drink.

name: DemonicAngel 123
text: Really good pizza and atmosphere! I love that they have gluten free and vegan/ No GMO options. I even noticed when preparing my gluten free pizza the cook changed her gloves (as they should). They have a service line style when creating the …More

name: KaCd Lau
text: That the place was okay. It's great that you can get unlimited toppings. The place serves Halal meat for all toppings, except chicken. The taste of the Halal meat made it feel like at The Halal Guys across the road. Order the pan pizza .. at least there's more pie. The regular pizza is paper thin pie crust. I think they use Nan bread.

name: jeremy jaeger
text: This place is great for a create your own place. The personal is only 8 bucks and it’s actually quite tasty. Great for families or quick on the go that isn’t McDonalds or Taco Bell.

name: Ricardo Morales
text: Super clean, and great vegan options.  Kid’s bundle comes with pizza, dessert and drink.  Line was like big but pizza came out fairly quickly.  Prices ok.

name: RobRich
text: BYO Personal pizza with  Collie flower crust was delicious yet pricey. But like they say, you get what you pay for and this was worth it. Especially for a low carb option, it cant be beat.

name: Sameera Namazi
text: Service wasn't as fast as I would expect for this place but it was delicious nonetheless!

name: Anonymous Reviewer
text: The dining room itself is very clean and tidy. The online ordering system is very easy to follow. The staff was very kind and friendly. …More

name: Lindsea C-V
text: I've been eagerly awaiting this place to open since I first saw the sign on the door. This was totally worth the wait. It's awesome as a vegan to be able to go to a pizza place and have a pizza with cheese on it. Most pizza places in the …More

name: Lisa Amiano
text: Pizza is absolutely delicious and fresh. Dough is made from scratch nothing frozen as well as all fresh ingredient toppings. Staff super friendly professional helpful. Will most definitely be returning!

name: Zachary Keller
text: The portion sizes are great value for your money, and the taste is incredible. The customization you can do with your pizza is fantastic and really unique. If you're looking for something new, I'd definitely recommend this place, as it's …More

name: Eeny Beeny
text: Great,  friendly service.  Easy to read menu.  We got 2 personal pizzas, one with Italian crust,  another with cauliflower crust.  Both crusts were delicious.  Marinara and Alfredo sauces were really great too.  Unlimited toppings really makes your pizza variations endless.

name: Tiffany Patterson
text: This store came together nicely and the food is well prepared and tasty. Every time I go the staff is away friendly and very helpful. Most importantly the store is clean. Alnissa and Mia works hard to ensure great customer service. Thank …More

name: Felicia Dawkins
text: Had the Cauliflower crust 11" pizza here. It was very delicious.  The combos are enough for two. I was able to select the topping I wanted and pizza was made fresh. I waited 10min tops. The service was ok, my only issue  i wasn't told the Cauliflower crust would be extra.

name: Brandon Levrault
text: Let's just say, brown lettuce followed by a soggy center crust. Server dropped my pizza which caused my wife to either eat without me or wait and let her food get cold. No offer to warm up her food in the oven at all. This is nothing more …More

name: Ananya Gupta
text: If you were expecting this pie five Pizza Ria to be a reasonable consolation for the lack of Blaze Pizza in the area, be prepared to be deeply disappointed. From the spicy pizza sauce II selection of toppings and the quality of fire baking …More

name: Mike Yosi
text:
Build your own pie is great.
Cauliflower crust is a solid alternative.
Premium pricing for having all these options.

name: Caitlin alexis
text: Great concept and pretty tasty.   It's more of a craft style pizza than a traditional pie, but it's well worth it

name: Katie
text: Delicious pizza. Variety of toppings, cheeses and crusts available. Fresh tasting every time and quick service. I recommend

name: Erik Cohen
text: Fantastic pizza - I wasn't expecting to like this as much as I did. They have a combo meal with a personal pizza, a salad, and a drink. The pizza came out very quickly and tasted amazing. I will certainly go back again soon.

name: Kevin Dudek
text: This place just opened and this was the first time here. No toilet paper or paper towels in restroom. No medium covers for fountain drinks. Told them the order was to eat in and they packaged it all up as if it was ordered to go. It was clean though.

name: Ahmed Chohan
text: Pizza was great as you can customize it from the selection. Great for dine in with family and friends. Only down size is bit expensive if comparing with other pizza shops

name: Lauren Gonzalez
text: This place is being run by children who look stressed out. Although, they were very, very nice staff...The kids were inexperienced. The place is clean, but pizza not great!  Pizza wasn't hot enough when it came out. Sauce didn't taste too good either.  Too bad we didn't get a "Blaze Pizza" in East Brunswick.

name: Reem Saud
text: So delicious experience, variety of toppings, and it's so yumm. Worth every penny.

name: Chrissy
text: The food was ehhh and considering it's only been open a week it should've been cleaner. Not a big fan wouldn't be surprised if it doesn't last very long. For it opening within this past week, you would think it would be crowded. Hopefully …More

name: jack schuchardt
text: This pie five is not open yet but hopeing it's as good as the pizza I've had at there other locations. The location looks nice so far. After it opens I'll visit and update my review.

name: Eleanora Feeney
text: I moved to LA from the east coast 10 years ago - haven't found a better NY style pizza than at Village. Also, best calzone in town, IMHO.

name: EMILY VAN BENTHUYSEN
text: Good spot for fast pizza. If you’re into lots of toppings, this is your spot. They have unlimited ones.

name: Jim Mills
text: Good pizza at a good price. Fast service. The gluten free crust is surprisingly good.

name: Syed Ali
text: Nice menu, create your own pizza with unlimited toppings for a flat price of $7.99 ? I say thats a great deal !  Baked upon order too! Its like a subway for Pizzas.  The place is clean and toppings seem fresh. They also serve this …More

name: Jaeho Chung
text: This place was just okay. At least we can choose what to add right there, and Pizza comes out pretty quick. Other than that, nothing special.

name: Harrison Cosentino
text: Cheap pizza, but definitely not good. The pizza is all made quickly fast but it does not seem very fresh. The dough is not cooled for a few days so it comes out very thin and tastes like naan bread instead.

name: Alan Carter
text: Fast food pizza nothing special. Many better options.  One and done.

name: Daniel Morris
text: Fast food pizza.  Best thing is unlimited toppings at no extra cost

name: Faraaz Khan
text: At first I was reluctant to visit such an establishment, however, my expectations were blown. Pie Five is the Chipotle for pizza, $8 for an 11” pizza with unlimited toppings. Who can beat that? …More

name: Muhammad Sheikh
text: Behind the counter pizza making environment should be cleaner and professional. Their product is good.

name: Doc Dirty
text: It was ok prices r great for pizza i would go back

name: Mohammad Ulazeem
text: Great food all the meats are halal and very clean place I'll go again and I recommend this place to everyone

name: Arun Govil Madiraju
text: Nicely maintained place . Great ingredients, baked to the Perfection.

name: Nick Krissoff
text: Food was delicious such a large portion for the price and unlimited toppings he bundles are great deal for lunch service is fast staff are friendly would definitely dine here again

name: vidhi sheth
text: Pizza was great.. toppings are fresh, good variety and options.. would definetly come back!!!

name: Donna Jakubowski
text: Save your momey it was the worst pizza I ever ate!!!  It's not real pizza at alll!

name: Paula W
text: Saw their sign up last night. Windows still covered in Muscle Maker Grill signs and menu. Inside is barren. 3 “missed delivery” stickers from UPS dated 10/2, 10/3, 10/4. It’s already 11/1. What a joke. They don’t plan to open any time soon, let alone start construction. Why even bother having a listing?

name: Wesley
text: Good personal pizza and dessert. I'll check them out again.

name: Jamie Marie Flores
text: You wouldn't expect this pizza to be so good but it is. The cheese is fantastic.

name: Ken Guell
text: Fun. Quick. Affordable.

name: Umair Osman
text: Love five star pizza !!

text: So... i didnt know how low the calorie count was!
